meanings.definition: To revoke or cancel (an agreement or decision)
meanings.sent1: The teacher rescinds the homework assignment due to the snow day.
meanings.sent2: The company rescinds its job offer after discovering the applicant's dishonesty.
meanings.sent3: The magician rescinds his promise to make the rabbit disappear, revealing it in his hat instead.
meanings.sent4: The storm rescinds the peaceful atmosphere, bringing in thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The judge rescinds the guilty verdict, declaring the defendant innocent.

meanings.definition: To take back or withdraw (a statement or offer)
meanings.sent1: She rescinds her apology after realizing she did nothing wrong.
meanings.sent2: The customer rescinds his order when he finds out the product is out of stock.
meanings.sent3: The child rescinds his promise to share his toys, deciding to keep them all for himself.
meanings.sent4: The artist rescinds her signature from the painting, claiming it was a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The politician rescinds his support for the bill, citing new information that changes his stance.
